channel.title: Public int ObjectsId[] problem

item.title: Public int ObjectsId[] problem
item.dc:creator: @AD_LVL_7 AD LVL 7
item.description:
@AD_LVL_7 wrote:

so, i want to create this

public int ObjecIds[] = {1530,1531};

where between these 2 ‘{’ ‘}’ should come all the Object IDs
and then in case 132: i am just needing to enter this

if(ObjecIds == ObjectId){ DeletingDoorz(objectX, objectY, objectID); //Also changing later }

so when I enter enother number in the ObjecIds, that DeletingDoorz will also work for
that Id.

EDIT: Don’t reply, let this topic die, found a way (finally) to do it

Read full topic

item.title: Public int ObjectsId[] problem
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

[quote=“AD LVL 7, post:1, topic:111362”]currently i am trying to find something to delete my door objects,
but not taking a lot of space in my parseincoming packets.
so i try to do it with public int ObjectsId[]

public int ObjecIds[] = {1530,1531}; public boolean isObjecIds(int objects) { for(int i = 0; i < objects.length; i++) { if(ObjecIds[i] == objects) return true; } return false; }
^== code So far, and this is it gotta do to work ===v

if(objectID == isObjecIds(**DunnoYet**)){ DeletingDoorz(objectX, objectY, objectID); //Also changing later }

still, doesn’t work correctly, Anybody can help me?[/quote]

Great attempt, nice to see you actually tried. Well, lets think about this, if you want to take an array as a parameter.
Here’s an example method.

public void example(String[] args){}

You can then cycle through the array, and do whatever else you need. I’m going to need more information if you want more help though

Read full topic
